paper_abstract: MOVING COMPUTATION NEAR MEMORY HAS BECOME MORE PRACTICAL BECAUSE OF 3D STACKING TECHNOLOGY. THIS ARTICLE DISCUSSES IN-MEMORY MAPREDUCE IN THE CONTEXT OF NEAR-DATA COMPUTING (NDC). THE AUTHORS CONSIDER TWO NDC ARCHITECTURES: ONE THAT EXPLOITS HYBRID MEMORY CUBE DEVICES AND ONE THAT DOES NOT. THEY EXAMINE THE BENEFITS OF DIFFERENT NDC APPROACHES AND QUANTIFY THE POTENTIAL FOR IMPROVEMENT FOR AN IMPORTANT EMERGING BIG-DATA WORKLOAD.
paper_title: COMPARING IMPLEMENTATIONS OF NEAR-DATA COMPUTING WITH IN-MEMORY MAPREDUCE WORKLOADS
